vague_description: Determining the optimal production strategy for car oils with limited resources to maximize profits.
detailed_description: A car manufacturer makes two types of car oils: Oil Max and Oil Max Pro. A container of Oil Max contains \param{AinMax} grams of substance A, \param{BinMax} grams of substance B and \param{CinMax} grams of substance C. A container of Oil Max Pro contains \param{AinMaxPro} grams of substance A, \param{BinMaxPro} grams of substance B and \param{CinMaxPro} grams of substance C. The car manufacturer has \param{TotalA} grams of substance A, \param{TotalB} grams of substance B, \param{TotalC} grams of substance C. In addition, the profit per container of Oil Max is $\param{ProfitMax} and the profit per container of Oil Max Pro is $\param{ProfitMaxPro}. How many containers of each type of oil should the car manufacturer make to maximize profit?
target_objective: Maximize the total profit from the production of Oil Max and Oil Max Pro containers
target_constraints: Number of Oil Max containers is non-negative
Number of Oil Max Pro containers is non-negative
Total grams of substance A used in all containers is at most TotalA
Total grams of substance B used in all containers is at most TotalB
Total grams of substance C used in all containers is at most TotalC
target_parameters: Amount of substance A in a container of Oil Max
Amount of substance B in a container of Oil Max
Amount of substance C in a container of Oil Max
Amount of substance A in a container of Oil Max Pro
Amount of substance B in a container of Oil Max Pro
Amount of substance C in a container of Oil Max Pro
Total available amount of substance A
Total available amount of substance B
Total available amount of substance C
Profit per container of Oil Max
Profit per container of Oil Max Pro
